fields.description:
When starting multiple instances (ie. using "-n (x>1))", not all instance of the group gets a public IP. Sometimes, the instances remain in "pending" state forever while the CC and NCs reports all instance to be running (Extant). In the later case, the CLC won't report the instance as running until the CLC is restarted and at this time only private addresses are assigned to the instance. 

I had 2 setups. My original setup had 1 CLC/WS, 1 CC/SC and 10 NCs. In this setup, I was able to reproduce this problem 100% of the time launching 5 m1.xlarge (modified) or 5 m2.xlarge (unmodified) where none of the instance would get a public IP and many times (not always), the CLC will stop communicating with the CC. But if I start 5 instance with 5 reservation, all works fine.

To cleanup the system and capture better logs, I reduced the number of NCs to 6 and noticed that the system behaved a little better (ie. some instance would now get public IPs rather than none).

I will include the log files for the scenario where I launched 5 m2.2xlarge instances using a single reservation and only 2 instances got a public IP...

fields.summary: Starting multiple instances results in public IP assignment failure

comments.body: Another thing I noticed is that, when terminating the 5 instances, sometimes they get stuck in "shutting-down" state forever (more than 5 minutes) when the CC has them marked as tear-down and even after they are no longer reported by CC. Restarting the CLC cause the CLC to now report the proper state... Again, this is as if the CLC is no longer querying the CC for state?

One more thing I noticed in the customer logs is that, when starting 45 instances under a single reservation, the CLC cloud-cluster seems to report that 37 run instance request were sent followed by a 32 seconds pause and then the remaining 8 run instance request are sent. On the CC side, we seem to receive 8 run instance request, then a 32 seconds pause, then 12 more instance, then 32 more seconds of pause followed by 17 run instance request, another 32 seconds pause and finally, the remaining 8 run instance request are received.... Don't know why so many pause but I feel the assign address are timing out on the CLC resulting in no public IP being associated with these instance.

The ClusterAllocater.SubmitAllocation.apply() is timing out after 4 minutes at:
StatefulMessageSet.transition(StatefulMessageSet.java:162) we then fire an exception and abort the callback
it fails as we try and release the address at: ResourceToken.abort(ResourceToken.java:195)
with the error: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot mark address as unallocating[allocated.false->unallocated.true] when it is unallocated.false: Address 10.111.100.33  
AddressTransition unallocating:impending->unallocated(false).

Why is ClusterAllocator.transition( final E currentState )   timing out at:
(line 162 ) Object o = request.getResponse( ).get( 240, TimeUnit.SECONDS ); timing out?
setting it to 1800 (30 minutes) did not help.

I will continue to investigate I am waiting for QA System to come back up.

[~kedwards] , [~chuck] , [~lwade]
The reason the call to "this.token.getCluster( ).refreshResources( );"  fails and why the address assign never happens for m2.2xlarge images is a
ReadTimeoutException at (Nodes.java):274.  The non-configurable time out for this  is StackConfiguration.CLIENT_INTERNAL_TIMEOUT_SECS
which is set at 60 seconds. I will investigate changing this timeout (make configurable?) and try and figure out why the AsyncRequest is timing out on the back end.

One thing I noticed is that following this, doDescribeResources are no longer going? The CLC call timed out at 19:41:33 but it seems like the CC did not receive (handle it) until 19:42:02?? I wonder if a deadlock occurred between the doDescribeResources and doDescribeServices causing the describe resources to no longer being handled by the CC a couple times a minutes (or the CLC never sends them out?).
Added the CC log file from [~mmunn1]'s setup.

Changing the timeout did not help resolve the issue it just delays the message being sent to the CC after it times out. I agree with Charles it looks like there is deadlock on the CC side with DescribeServicesType. If I comment out the call to  AsyncRequests.sendSync( ccConfig, msg ); at Nodes.java (269) the addresses get assigned and the instances start as expected. This issue was introduced in 3.3.0 with the call to  this.token.getCluster( ).refreshResources( );  at line 148 in VmRunCallback.java. This was added to to get the updated resource counts form the backend for "unordered" instance types, this is why we are seeing this only for m2.2xlarge or larger types.
Understood, thanks [~mmunn1]

[~mmunn1],

I'll take a look at it this morning and make this my top priority. I have 2 questions you may be able to answer me:

2) This new call introduced on the CLC that you are referring to, do we know why this was added or what issue it was supposed to resolve?

[~kedwards],

[~mmunn1] and I need an answer on question #2 in my previous comment. Can you make sure we can an answer from [~decker] or whomever can answer this.

After more investigation these 2 threads appears to simply be the monitor and sensor threads sleeping for a short period of time... Looking at the log files, I can still see the monitor thread being active....

[~decker] and I spend the evening looking at the issue. When the system is stuck, we clearly see the CLC/CC TCP connection being established between the 2 systems but the CLC never really send the request on the wire? [~decker] created a patch that seemed to resolve the issue by moving the time the cluster gets refreshed when the list of VM type is unordered. I will push this change to my private branch dev/chuck/EUCA-8510, launch a new setup and test this a little more. I have included the patch file.

Confirmed that the patch fixed the issue. I tested the following sequences:

{noformat}
Default instance-types
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m2.2xlarge -n 1
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m2.2xlarge -n 5
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m2.2xlarge -n 6
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m1.small -n 48


euca-modify-instance-type -m 4096 -d 15 t1.micro
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro	1	4096	15

euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck -t m2.2xlarge -n 1
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m2.2xlarge -n 5
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m2.2xlarge -n 6
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t t1.micro -n 6
euca-run-instances emi-04773AF1 -k chuck t m1.small -n 48
{noformat}

[~kedwards], can you find someone to review the patch. I just started a full QA sequence and should get some results by COB. If review is good and sequence is good, then I'll merge into maint/3.4/testing.
Ran QA sequence successfully. Code merged under maint/3.4/testing.
